revised_title: A Study of the Nuclear Apparatus in Bacteria
tldr: The author investigates the nuclear apparatus of bacteria, specifically the chromatinic dumbbell-shaped bodies, using the Feulgen process. These bodies are found in resting bacterial spores and vegetative cells from young cultures. The author concludes that these dumbbell-shaped bodies are comparable to the chromosomes of plant and animal cells, and they grow and divide with the organism, preceding the division of the cell.
